what: Convert Files That Use palmerpenguins To Use datasets `penguins`
title: Convert Files That Use palmerpenguins To Use datasets `penguins`
text: Convert scripts use palmerpenguins library use versions penguins penguins_raw datasets now R-devel, coming R 4.5. Palmer Penguins data become popular R community, especially educational contexts, alternative iris dataset. Including datasets R makes widely available, easier get started , especially new R users, use teaching. version penguins R’s datasets package shorter variable names palmerpenguins equivalent. differences : bill_dep instead bill_depth_mm bill_len instead bill_length_mm flipper_len instead flipper_length_mm body_mass instead body_mass_g changes made compact code data display. (e.g. printing penguins now shows columns 80 characters). mean, however, wanting use R’s version penguins, isn’t simply case removing call library(palmerpenguins) script still running. basepenguins package takes care converting files remove call library(palmerpenguins) makes necessary conversions variable names, ensuring resulting scripts still run.

title: Convert Files That Use palmerpenguins To Use datasets `penguins`
text: can install development version basepenguins GitHub :

title: Convert Files That Use palmerpenguins To Use datasets `penguins`
text: quick tour. extensive guide, see Get Started vignette, vignette("basepenguins").

title: Convert Files That Use palmerpenguins To Use datasets `penguins`
text: Conversions can also run -place, overwrite files. ’s , limited R scripts, though don’t execute chunk :
code: # get absolute paths of example files input <- example_files(full.names = TRUE)  # See one of the input files cat(readLines(input[2]), sep = "\n")  #> library(palmerpenguins) #> library(ggplot2) #> library(dplyr) #>  #> # exploring scatterplots #> penguins |> #>   select(body_mass_g, ends_with("_mm")) |> #>   glimpse() #>  #> # Scatterplot example: penguin flipper length versus body mass #> ggplot(data = penguins, aes(x = flipper_length_mm, y = body_mass_g)) + #>   geom_point(aes(color = species, shape = species), size = 2) + #>   scale_color_manual(values = c("darkorange", "darkorchid", "cyan4")) # generate output file paths (by default prefix "_new" to input filenames) output <- output_paths(input) # convert the files result <- convert_files(input, output) #> - In /private/var/folders/zd/v1_3x7fs7h9bjxmv6thqx30h0000gq/T/RtmpjX8utG/temp_libpath1164130dc63f2/basepenguins/extdata/penguins_new.R, ends_with("_mm") replaced on line 7 - please check that the subsitution is appropriate. #> - Please check the changed output files. #> - Remember to re-knit or re-render and changed Rmarkdown or Quarto documents. # See which files have changed result #> $changed #>       /private/var/folders/zd/v1_3x7fs7h9bjxmv6thqx30h0000gq/T/RtmpjX8utG/temp_libpath1164130dc63f2/basepenguins/extdata/analysis/penguins.qmd  #> "/private/var/folders/zd/v1_3x7fs7h9bjxmv6thqx30h0000gq/T/RtmpjX8utG/temp_libpath1164130dc63f2/basepenguins/extdata/analysis/penguins_new.qmd"  #>                  /private/var/folders/zd/v1_3x7fs7h9bjxmv6thqx30h0000gq/T/RtmpjX8utG/temp_libpath1164130dc63f2/basepenguins/extdata/penguins.R  #>            "/private/var/folders/zd/v1_3x7fs7h9bjxmv6thqx30h0000gq/T/RtmpjX8utG/temp_libpath1164130dc63f2/basepenguins/extdata/penguins_new.R"  #>  #> $not_changed #> character(0) # See the changes to the input file we saw above cat(readLines(output[2]), sep = "\n")  #>  #> library(ggplot2) #> library(dplyr) #>  #> # exploring scatterplots #> penguins |> #>   select(body_mass, starts_with("flipper_"), starts_with("bill_")) |> #>   glimpse() #>  #> # Scatterplot example: penguin flipper length versus body mass #> ggplot(data = penguins, aes(x = flipper_len, y = body_mass)) + #>   geom_point(aes(color = species, shape = species), size = 2) + #>   scale_color_manual(values = c("darkorange", "darkorchid", "cyan4")) convert_files_inplace(input, extensions = "R")

title: Convert Files That Use palmerpenguins To Use datasets `penguins`
text: Whilst convert_files() allows conversion specified files, convert_dir() convert files (stated extensions) given directory (subdirectories). also version modify files place (executed ):
code: example_dir <- example_dir() output_dir <- tempdir() result <- convert_dir(example_dir, output_dir) #> - In /var/folders/zd/v1_3x7fs7h9bjxmv6thqx30h0000gq/T//RtmpMwC006/penguins.R, ends_with("_mm") replaced on line 7 - please check that the subsitution is appropriate. #> - Please check the changed output files. #> - Remember to re-knit or re-render and changed Rmarkdown or Quarto documents. result #> $changed #> /private/var/folders/zd/v1_3x7fs7h9bjxmv6thqx30h0000gq/T/RtmpjX8utG/temp_libpath1164130dc63f2/basepenguins/extdata/analysis/penguins.qmd  #>                                                     "/var/folders/zd/v1_3x7fs7h9bjxmv6thqx30h0000gq/T//RtmpMwC006/analysis/penguins.qmd"  #>            /private/var/folders/zd/v1_3x7fs7h9bjxmv6thqx30h0000gq/T/RtmpjX8utG/temp_libpath1164130dc63f2/basepenguins/extdata/penguins.R  #>                                                                "/var/folders/zd/v1_3x7fs7h9bjxmv6thqx30h0000gq/T//RtmpMwC006/penguins.R"  #>  #> $not_changed #> /private/var/folders/zd/v1_3x7fs7h9bjxmv6thqx30h0000gq/T/RtmpjX8utG/temp_libpath1164130dc63f2/basepenguins/extdata/analysis/penguins_new.qmd  #>                                                     "/var/folders/zd/v1_3x7fs7h9bjxmv6thqx30h0000gq/T//RtmpMwC006/analysis/penguins_new.qmd"  #>            /private/var/folders/zd/v1_3x7fs7h9bjxmv6thqx30h0000gq/T/RtmpjX8utG/temp_libpath1164130dc63f2/basepenguins/extdata/penguins_new.R  #>                                                                "/var/folders/zd/v1_3x7fs7h9bjxmv6thqx30h0000gq/T//RtmpMwC006/penguins_new.R" convert_dir_inplace(example_dir)

what: Convert files to use datasets versions of penguins and penguins_raw — convert_files
title: Convert files to use datasets versions of penguins and penguins_raw — convert_files
text: functions convert files use palmerpenguins package use versions penguins penguins_raw included datasets package R 4.5.0. removes calls library(palmerpenguins) make necessary changes variable names (see Details section ).

title: Convert files to use datasets versions of penguins and penguins_raw — convert_files
code: convert_files(input, output, extensions = c("R", "r", "qmd", "rmd", "Rmd"))  convert_files_inplace(input, extensions = c("R", "r", "qmd", "rmd", "Rmd"))  convert_dir(input, output, extensions = c("R", "r", "qmd", "rmd", "Rmd"))  convert_dir_inplace(input, extensions = c("R", "r", "qmd", "rmd", "Rmd"))

title: Convert files to use datasets versions of penguins and penguins_raw — convert_files
text: input convert_files() convert_files_inplace(): character vector file paths convert. Can relative absolute paths. convert_dir() convert_dir_inplace(): string path directory files convert. output convert_files(): character vector output file paths, NULL modify files place. provided, must length input. Can absolute relative paths. convert_dir(): string output directory, NULL modify files directory place. extensions character vector file extensions process, defaults R scripts R Markdown Quarto documents.

title: Convert files to use datasets versions of penguins and penguins_raw — convert_files
text: list (returned invisibly) two components: changed: character vector paths files modified. not_changed: character vector paths files modified. Files changed load palmerpenguins package via library(palmerpenguins), library('palmerpenguins') library("palmerpenguins"), one specified extensions. changed not_changed vectors, subsets output paths, provided, corresponding input paths names. output specified, vectors subsets input paths, vectors named.

title: Convert files to use datasets versions of penguins and penguins_raw — convert_files
text: Files converted : Replacing library(palmerpenguins) "" Replacing variable names: bill_length_mm -> bill_len bill_depth_mm -> bill_dep flipper_length_mm -> flipper_len body_mass_g -> body_mass Replacing ends_with("_mm") starts_with("flipper_"), starts_with(bill_) Non-convertible files (without specified extensions) copied output location output provided, modified. output files directory (yet) exist, created (recursively necessary). Replacing ends_with("_mm") starts_with("flipper_"), starts_with(bill_) ensures modified R code always run. starts_with("flipper_") intuitively necessary, one variable starting "flipper_", penguins, code error inside dplyr::(select), even flipper_len data frame (trying select flipper_len directly cause error column data frame). educational context, suggest manually editing converted files replace starts_with("flipper_") flipper_len appropriate. facilitate , functions documented produce message indicating files line numbers ends_with("_mm") substitution made.

title: Convert files to use datasets versions of penguins and penguins_raw — convert_files
code: # Note that all examples below write output to a temporary directory # and file paths are relative to that directory (unless otherwise stated).  # For all examples below, use a copy of the examples provided by the package, # copied to an "examples" directory in the working directory example_dir("examples")  # Single file - new output result <- convert_files("examples/penguins.R", "penguins_new.R") #> - ends_with("_mm") replaced on line 7 in penguins_new.R #> - Please check the changed output files. cat(readLines("penguins_new.R"), sep = "\n") # view changes #>  #> library(ggplot2) #> library(dplyr) #>  #> # exploring scatterplots #> penguins |> #>   select(body_mass, starts_with("flipper_"), starts_with("bill_")) |> #>   glimpse() #>  #> # Scatterplot example: penguin flipper length versus body mass #> ggplot(data = penguins, aes(x = flipper_len, y = body_mass)) + #>   geom_point(aes(color = species, shape = species), size = 2) + #>   scale_color_manual(values = c("darkorange", "darkorchid", "cyan4"))  # Single file - copy, then modify that in place file.copy("examples/penguins.R", "penguins_copy.R") #> [1] TRUE convert_files_inplace("penguins_copy.R") #> - ends_with("_mm") replaced on line 7 in penguins_copy.R #> - Please check the changed output files.  # Convert all files in a directory result <- convert_dir("examples", "new_directory") #> - ends_with("_mm") replaced on line 7 in new_directory/penguins.R #> - Please check the changed output files. #> - Remember to re-knit or re-render and changed Rmarkdown or Quarto documents. result #> $changed #>        examples/nested/penguins.qmd                 examples/penguins.R  #> "new_directory/nested/penguins.qmd"          "new_directory/penguins.R"  #>  #> $not_changed #>               examples/no_penguins.Rmd        examples/nested/not_a_script.md  #>        "new_directory/no_penguins.Rmd" "new_directory/nested/not_a_script.md"  #>   # Convert multiple files to new locations input_files <- file.path("examples", example_files()) output_files <- output_paths(input_files, dir = "new_dir") result <- convert_files(input_files, output_files) #> - ends_with("_mm") replaced on line 7 in new_dir/examples/penguins_new.R #> - Please check the changed output files. #> - Remember to re-knit or re-render and changed Rmarkdown or Quarto documents.   # Overwrite the files in `"examples"` result <- convert_dir_inplace("examples") #> - ends_with("_mm") replaced on line 7 in examples/penguins.R #> - Please check the changed output files. #> - Remember to re-knit or re-render and changed Rmarkdown or Quarto documents. result #> $changed #> [1] "examples/nested/penguins.qmd" "examples/penguins.R"          #>  #> $not_changed #> [1] "examples/no_penguins.Rmd"        "examples/nested/not_a_script.md" #>

what: List or find example files from basepenguins package — example_files
title: List or find example files from basepenguins package — example_files
text: functions provides access example files included basepenguins package. example_files() called path = NULL, lists available example files. called specific path, returns full path file.

title: List or find example files from basepenguins package — example_files
code: example_files(path = NULL, full.names = FALSE, recursive = TRUE)  example_dir(copy.dir = NULL)

title: List or find example files from basepenguins package — example_files
text: path Character string. NULL (default), lists available example files. specified, returns full path specified file directory. full.names Logical. TRUE``, returns full file paths rather relative paths. used path = NULL`. Default FALSE. recursive Logical. TRUE``, lists files subdirectories recursively. used path = NULL`. Default TRUE. copy.dir Character string. directory name path directory files example directory copied. NULL (default) returns path example directory installed package.

title: List or find example files from basepenguins package — example_files
text: example_files: path = NULL, returns character vector available file/directory names. path specified, returns full file path requested resource. example_dir: path directory containing examples.

title: List or find example files from basepenguins package — example_files
code: # List all files and directories in the root directory example_files() #> [1] "nested/not_a_script.md" "nested/penguins.qmd"    "no_penguins.Rmd"        #> [4] "penguins.R"             example_files(recursive = FALSE) #> [1] "nested"          "no_penguins.Rmd" "penguins.R"      example_files(full.names = TRUE) #> [1] "/home/runner/work/_temp/Library/basepenguins/extdata/nested/not_a_script.md" #> [2] "/home/runner/work/_temp/Library/basepenguins/extdata/nested/penguins.qmd"    #> [3] "/home/runner/work/_temp/Library/basepenguins/extdata/no_penguins.Rmd"        #> [4] "/home/runner/work/_temp/Library/basepenguins/extdata/penguins.R"              # Get the full path to a specific example files example_files("penguins.R") #> [1] "/home/runner/work/_temp/Library/basepenguins/extdata/penguins.R" example_files("nested/penguins.qmd") #> [1] "/home/runner/work/_temp/Library/basepenguins/extdata/nested/penguins.qmd"  # Get the path to all examplesss example_dir() #> [1] "/home/runner/work/_temp/Library/basepenguins/extdata"

what: List files to convert in a directory — files_to_convert
title: List files to convert in a directory — files_to_convert
text: function lists files directory (subdirectories) match specified file extensions. can used helper find files paths pass convert_files() convert_files_inplace(), preview files functions, well convert_dir() convert_dir_inplace() look convert. can also used input output_paths() help generate output paths new files.

title: List files to convert in a directory — files_to_convert
code: files_to_convert(   dir,   full.names = FALSE,   extensions = c("R", "r", "qmd", "rmd", "Rmd") )

title: List files to convert in a directory — files_to_convert
text: dir character string specifying directory path search full.names Logical. TRUE, returns full file paths rather relative paths. Default FALSE. extensions character vector file extensions filter . Default c("R", "r", "qmd", "rmd", "Rmd"). NULL empty, returns files.

title: List files to convert in a directory — files_to_convert
text: character vector file paths match specified extensions.

title: List files to convert in a directory — files_to_convert
code: example_dir <- example_dir() # Get examples directory files_to_convert(example_dir) #> [1] "nested/penguins.qmd" "no_penguins.Rmd"     "penguins.R"          files_to_convert(example_dir, full.names = TRUE) #> [1] "/home/runner/work/_temp/Library/basepenguins/extdata/nested/penguins.qmd" #> [2] "/home/runner/work/_temp/Library/basepenguins/extdata/no_penguins.Rmd"     #> [3] "/home/runner/work/_temp/Library/basepenguins/extdata/penguins.R"          files_to_convert(example_dir, extensions = "R") #> [1] "penguins.R" files_to_convert(example_dir, extensions = NULL) # all files #> [1] "nested/not_a_script.md" "nested/penguins.qmd"    "no_penguins.Rmd"        #> [4] "penguins.R"

what: Generate modified file paths by adding prefixes and/or suffixes — output_paths
title: Generate modified file paths by adding prefixes and/or suffixes — output_paths
text: function takes vector file paths returns vector modified paths prefixes /suffixes added filenames. useful generating output paths convert_files() convert_dir() functions. files_to_convert() useful generating input paths.

title: Generate modified file paths by adding prefixes and/or suffixes — output_paths
Generate modified file paths by adding prefixes and/or suffixes — output_paths
text: paths character vector file paths modify prefix character string add beginning filename. Default "". suffix character string add end filename, extension. Default "_new". dir optional character string specifying output directory. provided, modified filenames placed directory. useful paths relative different output directory required. Default NULL.

title: Generate modified file paths by adding prefixes and/or suffixes — output_paths
text: character vector modified file paths specified prefixes suffixes. original paths preserved names returned vector.

title: Generate modified file paths by adding prefixes and/or suffixes — output_paths
code: # Get all convertible files from examples directory input_files_full <- files_to_convert(example_dir(), full.names = TRUE)  # Generate output paths with "_converted" suffix output_paths(input_files_full, suffix = "_converted") #>             /home/runner/work/_temp/Library/basepenguins/extdata/nested/penguins.qmd  #> "/home/runner/work/_temp/Library/basepenguins/extdata/nested/penguins_converted.qmd"  #>                 /home/runner/work/_temp/Library/basepenguins/extdata/no_penguins.Rmd  #>     "/home/runner/work/_temp/Library/basepenguins/extdata/no_penguins_converted.Rmd"  #>                      /home/runner/work/_temp/Library/basepenguins/extdata/penguins.R  #>          "/home/runner/work/_temp/Library/basepenguins/extdata/penguins_converted.R"   # Generate output paths in a specific directory, with relative paths as input input_files <- files_to_convert(example_dir()) output_paths(input_files, dir = "new_dir") # relative output paths #>               nested/penguins.qmd                   no_penguins.Rmd  #> "new_dir/nested/penguins_new.qmd"     "new_dir/no_penguins_new.Rmd"  #>                        penguins.R  #>          "new_dir/penguins_new.R"  output_paths(input_files, dir = tempdir()) # absolute output paths #>                       nested/penguins.qmd  #> "/tmp/RtmpdqInk9/nested/penguins_new.qmd"  #>                           no_penguins.Rmd  #>     "/tmp/RtmpdqInk9/no_penguins_new.Rmd"  #>                                penguins.R  #>          "/tmp/RtmpdqInk9/penguins_new.R"   # Add both prefix and suffix and place in a new directory output_paths(   c("analysis.R", "report.qmd"),   prefix = "processed_",   suffix = "_v2",   dir = tempdir() ) # Results in paths like "tempdir/processed_analysis_v2.R" #>                                analysis.R  #> "/tmp/RtmpdqInk9/processed_analysis_v2.R"  #>                                report.qmd  #> "/tmp/RtmpdqInk9/processed_report_v2.qmd"
